snippet: The company earned $1.87 billion for the fourth quarter of 2012, but its shares closed down 2.7 percent, to $37.56.
abstract: Coca-Cola reports an increase in its fourth-quarter profit, despite challenges from foreign exchange rates, reduced demand for carbonated beverages and rough market conditions in Europe and China; net income was $1.87 billion, or 41 cents a share, compared with $1.66 billion, or 36 cents a share a year earlier; revenue rose 4 percent, to $11.46 billion.
lead_paragraph: The company earned $1.87 billion for the fourth quarter of 2012, but its shares closed down 2.7 percent, to $37.56.

headline.seo: Coke’s Profit Rises, but Shares Fall
headline.main: Coca-Cola Lifts Profit, but Shares Close Down
headline.print_headline: Coca-Cola Lifts Profit, But Shares Close Down
